verses.verse: Cast <S%H7971><s%> your bread <S%H3899><s%> on <S%H6440><s%> the waters; <S%H4325><s%> for you shall find <S%H4672><s%> it after many <S%H7230><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> a portion <S%H2506><s%> to seven, <S%H7651><s%> yes, <S%H8083><s%> even to eight; for you don't <S%H3045><s%> know what evil <S%H7451><s%> will be on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

If the clouds <S%H5645><s%> are full <S%H4390><s%> of rain, <S%H1653><s%> they empty <S%H7324><s%> themselves on the earth; <S%H776><s%> and if a tree <S%H6086><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> toward the south, <S%H1864><s%> or toward the north, <S%H6828><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> where the tree <S%H6086><s%> falls, <S%H5307><s%> there shall it be. <S%H1933><s%>
He who observes <S%H8104><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> won't <S%H2232><s%> sow; and he who regards <S%H7200><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> won't <S%H7114><s%> reap.

As you don't <S%H3045><s%> know what is the way <S%H1870><s%> of the wind, <S%H7307><s%> nor how the bones <S%H6106><s%> grow in the womb <S%H990><s%> of her who is with child; <S%H4392><s%> even so you don't <S%H3045><s%> know the work <S%H4639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> who does all. <S%H6213><s%>

In the morning <S%H1242><s%> sow <S%H2232><s%> your seed, <S%H2233><s%> and in the evening <S%H6153><s%> don't <S%H3240><s%> withhold your hand; <S%H3027><s%> for you don't <S%H3045><s%> know which <S%H335><s%> will prosper, <S%H3787><s%> whether this or that, <S%H8147><s%> or whether they both will be equally <S%H259><s%> good. <S%H2896><s%>
Truly the light <S%H216><s%> is sweet, <S%H4966><s%> and a pleasant <S%H2896><s%> thing it is for the eyes <S%H5869><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Yes, <S%H120><s%> if a man lives <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> let him rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in them all; <S%H2142><s%> but let him remember the days <S%H3117><s%> of darkness, <S%H2822><s%> for they shall be many. <S%H7235><s%> All that comes <S%H935><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Rejoice, <S%H8055><s%> young man, <S%H970><s%> in your youth, <S%H3208><s%> and let your heart <S%H3820><s%> cheer <S%H2895><s%> you in the days <S%H3117><s%> of your youth, <S%H979><s%> and walk <S%H1980><s%> in the ways <S%H1870><s%> of your heart, <S%H3820><s%> and in the sight <S%H4758><s%> of your eyes; <S%H4758><s%> but know <S%H3045><s%> that for all these things God <S%H430><s%> will bring <S%H935><s%> you into judgment. <S%H4941><s%>

Therefore remove <S%H5493><s%> sorrow <S%H3708><s%> from your heart, <S%H3820><s%> and put away <S%H5674><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from your flesh; <S%H1320><s%> for youth <S%H7839><s%> and the dawn <S%H7839><s%> of life are vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
